content.webTitle: Sydney teenager in coma after falling five metres at party

fields.headline: Sydney teenager in coma after falling five metres at party
fields.bodyText: A teenage girl is in an induced coma after falling five metres while at a party in southern Sydney. Police say the 16-year-old was found at the bottom of a property in Yowie Bay just before midnight on Saturday when she tried to climb on to an outdoor stair lift to get up to the house. She slipped from the inclinator and fell on to a retaining wall before landing on the rocky shoreline below – a fall of nearly five metres, according to police. ABC news reported that the rescue operation was “extremely difficult” because the girl was a long way down from the house, with the water police called in to assist. Inspector Winston Pisani has told Macquarie Radio underage drinking is believed to have been a factor and the girl is in an induced coma in hospital. “At this stage she’s being treated at St George hospital, where she’s currently in the intensive care unit,” he said.
